accessibility.title: Accessibility
accessibility.description: These checks highlight opportunities to [improve the accessibility of your web app](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/lighthouse/accessibility/). Automatic detection can only detect a subset of issues and does not guarantee the accessibility of your web app, so [manual testing](https://web.dev/articles/how-to-review) is also encouraged.
accessibility.manualDescription: These items address areas which an automated testing tool cannot cover. Learn more in our guide on [conducting an accessibility review](https://web.dev/articles/how-to-review).

seo.title: SEO
seo.description: These checks ensure that your page is following basic search engine optimization advice. There are many additional factors Lighthouse does not score here that may affect your search ranking, including performance on [Core Web Vitals](https://web.dev/explore/vitals). [Learn more about Google Search Essentials](https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/35769).
seo.manualDescription: Run these additional validators on your site to check additional SEO best practices.

testssl.finding: repeated TCP connect problems, giving up

technologies.name: WordPress
technologies.description: WordPress is a free and open-source content management system written in PHP and paired with a MySQL or MariaDB database. Features include a plugin architecture and a template system.

technologies.name: Proton Mail
technologies.description: Proton Mail is the world’s largest secure email service with over 70 million users. Available on Web, iOS, Android, and desktop. Protected by Swiss privacy law.

technologies.name: MySQL
technologies.description: MySQL is an open-source relational database management system.

technologies.name: PHP
technologies.description: PHP is a general-purpose scripting language used for web development.

technologies.name: Firebase
technologies.description: Firebase is a Google-backed application development software that enables developers to develop iOS, Android and Web apps.

technologies.name: YouTube
technologies.description: YouTube is a video sharing service where users can create their own profile, upload videos, watch, like and comment on other videos.

technologies.name: Vimeo
technologies.description: Vimeo is a video hosting, sharing and services platform. Vimeo operation an ad-free basis by providing subscription plans.

technologies.name: MediaElement.js
technologies.description: MediaElement.js is a set of custom Flash plugins that mimic the HTML5 MediaElement API for browsers that don't support HTML5 or don't support the media codecs.

technologies.name: Varnish
technologies.description: Varnish is a reverse caching proxy.

technologies.name: Draftpress HFCM
technologies.description: Header Footer Code Manager by Draftpress is a easy interface to add snippets to the header or footer or above or below the content of your page.

technologies.name: WP Rocket
technologies.description: WP Rocket is a caching and performance optimisation plugin to improve the loading speed of WordPress websites.

technologies.name: Vue.js
technologies.description: Vue.js is an open-source model–view–viewmodel JavaScript framework for building user interfaces and single-page applications.

technologies.name: GSAP
technologies.description: GSAP is an animation library that allows you to create animations with JavaScript.

technologies.name: Yoast SEO
technologies.description: Yoast SEO is a search engine optimisation plugin for WordPress and other platforms.

technologies.name: Apache HTTP Server
technologies.description: Apache is a free and open-source cross-platform web server software.

technologies.name: Teads
technologies.description: Teads is a technology provider that sells ads on publisher websites.

technologies.name: Google Tag Manager
technologies.description: Google Tag Manager is a tag management system (TMS) that allows you to quickly and easily update measurement codes and related code fragments collectively known as tags on your website or mobile app.

technologies.name: Plausible
technologies.description: Plausible is an open-source alternative to Google Analytics.

technologies.name: Microsoft Advertising
technologies.description: Microsoft Advertising is an online advertising platform developed by Microsoft.

technologies.name: jQuery Migrate
technologies.description: Query Migrate is a javascript library that allows you to preserve the compatibility of your jQuery code developed for versions of jQuery older than 1.9.

technologies.name: jQuery
technologies.description: jQuery is a JavaScript library which is a free, open-source software designed to simplify HTML DOM tree traversal and manipulation, as well as event handling, CSS animation, and Ajax.

technologies.name: Isotope
technologies.description: Isotope.js is a JavaScript library that makes it easy to sort, filter, and add Masonry layouts to items on a webpage.

technologies.name: Criteo
technologies.description: Criteo provides personalised retargeting that works with Internet retailers to serve personalised online display advertisements to consumers who have previously visited the advertiser's website.

technologies.name: Priority Hints
technologies.description: Priority Hints exposes a mechanism for developers to signal a relative priority for browsers to consider when fetching resources.

technologies.name: reCAPTCHA
technologies.description: reCAPTCHA is a free service from Google that helps protect websites from spam and abuse.

technologies.name: Sendinblue
technologies.description: Sendinblue is an email marketing solution for small and medium-sized businesses that want to send and automate email marketing campaigns.

technologies.name: Webpack
technologies.description: Webpack is an open-source JavaScript module bundler.

technologies.name: RSS
technologies.description: RSS is a family of web feed formats used to publish frequently updated works—such as blog entries, news headlines, audio, and video—in a standardized format.

technologies.name: Open Graph
technologies.description: Open Graph is a protocol that is used to integrate any web page into the social graph.

technologies.name: Module Federation
technologies.description: Module Federation is a webpack technology for dynamically loading parts of other independently deployed builds.
